page.title: 08PANGBOURNE A - 2
page.content: {THE COPPER INN}is a popular, privately owned hotel. Originally called The Elephant, it was a coaching inn at the beginning of 19th Century. The hotel serves excellent English food and specialises in wines of Burgundy. Its well-furnished rooms include colour TV, radio, telephone (also electric trouser press and hair dryer in Executive Rooms) and tea and coffee facilities. A single room costs Â£37 and a double Â£45 per night. {THE WHITCHURCH TOLL BRIDGE} opened in 1792; it is owned by Whitchurch Bridge Company. It is manned throughout the year except at Christmas. The pedestrians and pedal cyclists are allowed free passage but the charges made are: horses and cattle .5p each; carts and carriages, 1p for two wheels and 2p for four wheels; motor cycles 2p; motor vehicles, 3p for 3 wheels
